result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell L Mills

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 and 15TR796 tracking together:
 Atty Hendee asks that Atty Gumz state the agreement because the matters have been discussed many times.  Atty Gumz states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM76.  Atty Hendee agrees.
Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM76.  Ct 2

Atty Gumz asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 in 15CM76:  Court orders 35 days in the Marquette County Jail
 Credit = 28 days
Time Served
Court Costs = 243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Ct. 2 to be dismissed and read-in
Restitution = $990.00 + $99.00 Surcharge = $1,089.00
Bond in both cases to be applied to Restitution

15FO49 to be dismissed 
15TR796 to be dismissed
Restitution = $1,089
15CM107:  Dismissed and read-in 

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for the balance:  $50.00/month commencing on December 1, 2017
Supplement to Disposition (Restitution)
of Warrant Cancellation MASO
**Defendant was picked up on Warrant; set cash bond.
*No contact with T.C.S., dob 3/5/1999, K.R.S., dob 8/8/00, Garrett Coyle or Timberlyn Bell

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court for Defendant Russell L Mills. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Russell L Mills appeared by video means.
15CM107 & 15CM76 tracking together:
Court questions the defendant as to why he did not appear at the April hearings.  Defendant was handling a loss at the time and did not handle it well.  
Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond in both cases totaling $1,000.  Court questions the cash bond on one of the cases.  Atty Hendee asks for this cash to be additional.  Atty Gumz states that he believes that the defendant will qualify and makes bond arguments and asks that $250 cash be ordered to cover both cases.

BY THE COURT:  15CM107:  Court orders an additional $250 cash.
15CM76:  Court orders a $250 cash bond.
All previous conditions will continue.

Court questions counsel on 15FO49 & 15TR796.  Atty Hendee requests the default be entered since it should have been.  Atty Gumz asks that they continue to track.
BY THE COURT:  15FO49 & 15TR796 will not default and ordered to track with the criminal cases.  
Return date scheduled for September 20, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 & 15TR796 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant has not been able to work due to medical reasons; requests a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for April 7, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 & 15TR796 tracking together:
  Atty Hendee requests warrant based on defendant's failure to appear.
Atty Gumz states that he has tried to get ahold of his client and asks for a stay of the warrant.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant will issue; stayed for 48 hours.
Per Judge; don't send notice out to defendant.  Return date scheduled for January 18, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Statement of Compliance

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 & 15TR796 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties have been trying to resolve all matters and will be asking for a return date in December.  Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for December 7, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 and 15TR796 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there has been discussions regarding all the matters for resolution but the parties are requesting a reset.
Atty Gumz agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 & 15TR796 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that he has not been able to meet with Atty Gumz on the matters.  Atty Gumz states that there is a proposal to the State and will be having further discussions regarding that proposal.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76, 15CM107, 15FO49 & 15TR796 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that the parties do not have resolution at this time.  Atty Gumz agrees and asks that these be set for Return.

BY THE COURT:  Set matters for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Return date scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial at 04-14-2016 08:30 am

Defendant Russell L Mills in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM76 & 15CM107 tracking:
Atty Hendee states that there may be other possible charges.  Atty Gumz states that he did withdraw the speedy trial demand and asks the court to set for Trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Trial.
bond continued.
15FO49 and 15TR796 tracking  Jury trial scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial at 09-04-2015 01:30 pm.
Jury trial at 09-15-2015 08:00 am.
Defendant's
statement of compliance
letter from P.D. regarding representation - none appointed - must apply

with conditions:
*No contact with T.C.S., dob 3/5/1999, K.R.S., dob 8/8/00, Garrett Coyle or Timberlyn Bell
*Defendant may return to the camper one time with Law Enforcement
Return date at 09-03-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Russell L Mills appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Chad A. Hendee appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests a $500 cash bond with conditions.  Atty Hendee states that there may be additional charges.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 cash bond with conditions:
*No contact with T.C.S., dob 3/5/1999, K.R.S., dob 8/8/00, Garrett Coyle or Timberlyn Bell
*Defendant may return to the camper one time with Law Enforcement

Court finds probable cause.
  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to get an Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
